item.name: Alchemists
item.comment: Tedious gimmick.

item.name: Augustus
item.comment: Good game to play with your parents, etc.

item.name: Automobile
item.conditiontext: New in shrink. Signed version #321 of 1500.

item.name: Battlestar Galactica
item.comment: Hard to beat the combination of role-playing and gameplay when done with mature, sophisticated gamers.

item.name: Betrayal at House on the Hill
Blood Bowl: Team Manager â€“ The Card Game
Brass
item.comment: Absolutely sublime.

item.name: Carcassonne: The Discovery
item.comment: Pleasant enough.

item.name: The Castles of Burgundy
item.comment: Rated 8 with 2-3 players.

item.name: Caylus
item.comment: A bit tedious.

item.name: Clans
item.comment: Unremarkable.

item.name: Coloretto
item.comment: perfect quick filler game

item.name: Commands & Colors: Ancients Expansion Pack #5 â€“ Epic Ancients II
item.comment: Failure as a multiplayer. Essentially splits the actions of one player among several and thus each player has the chance to do very little and sometimes nothing. Fine as a 2 player but this is a flawed design when considering its purpose.

item.name: Condottiere
item.comment: Solid filler.

item.name: Conflict of Heroes: Awakening the Bear! â€“ Russia 1941-42
Dead of Winter: A Crossroads Game
item.comment: Good example of why I hate Ameritrash games: simple, obvious, and uninteresting decisions with too much down time. I'd rather play the driest Euro or abstract (or stick needles in my eyes).

item.name: The Doge Ship
item.comment: Chaotic and hard to plan ahead. Recommend with less than five.

item.name: Domaine
item.comment: Quite engaging with nice brisk pace. It is over too quickly though.

item.name: Dominion
item.conditiontext: Only played once. Includes BGG promo cards.

item.name: Dune
item.comment: The best game ever if you are a fan of the Dune novels and play with a full compliment of six.

item.name: Eminent Domain
item.comment: Very little that is interesting going on in this game. Too bad I pre-ordered it.

item.name: Evolution
item.comment: Very cheap card stock used for cards. North Star should be embarrassed after raising so much money on kickstarter and having such flimsy cards.

item.name: First to Fight
item.comment: Ill conceived nonsense. Theme makes no sense and layout is ridiculous. May be the worst game ever.

item.name: Friday the 13th
item.comment: I have the iphone version and it is a nice solitaire game for that format.

item.name: Friedrich
item.comment: The perfect multiplayer light wargame. Brilliant and evocative design without player elimination.

item.name: Fury of Dracula (second edition)
item.comment: Cute enough but somewhat tedious.

item.name: Glory to Rome
item.comment: Under produced and under edited.

item.name: Hamburgum
item.comment: Like the mechanisms in the game but they are not intuitive and the game is difficult to teach.

item.name: Hammer of the Scots
item.comment: Lives up to the positive buzz.

item.name: The Hanging Gardens
item.comment: The ultimate game to play with your spouse. She/he will love it. I guarantee it.

item.name: Hansa
item.comment: Pretty and sweet with hypnotic gameplay.

item.name: Havoc: The Hundred Years War
item.comment: Fun poker variant but theme is so non-existent as to be silly.

item.name: Hera and Zeus
item.comment: Not ideal for play w/ spouse/girlfriend.

item.name: Here I Stand
item.comment: "Here I Sit" waiting 45 minutes until it is my turn again to take some simple action... Each faction's mini-game is an infantile but necessary distraction. I won as the Protestant faction only by translating the bible. None too exciting I assure you. Played with six and was so bored I had two other games going at the same time to entertain me between my turns.

item.name: Hive
item.comment: Don't usually like abstract games but this one is clever and quick.

item.name: Java
item.comment: Not my type of game. More puzzle than game.

item.name: Knights of Charlemagne
item.comment: I'm happy with the iphone version.

item.name: Legacy: The Testament of Duke de Crecy
item.comment: Charming and chick friendly but not sure about replayability.

item.name: Legendary Encounters: An Alien Deck Building Game
LibertÃ©
item.comment: The game is a quite fun and chaotic brain burner.

item.name: Lifeboats
item.conditiontext: Only played twice. Components in excellent condition. Box bottom has some splits however from shelf wear.

item.name: Lightning: Midway â€“ June 4th to June 6th, 1942
item.comment: Straight bluffing game that I doubt is worth playing much more than once.

item.name: Lords of Waterdeep
item.comment: Unexpectedly flavorless and routine Euro given the theme.

item.name: Lost Cities
item.comment: Wife loves it.

item.name: Manila
item.comment: Some of the critical comments are valid in that the game doesn't have long legs but it is so charming and such fun when you play with new gamers that the positives outweigh the negatives for me.

item.name: Mare Nostrum
item.comment: With the mythology expansion it has very little down time and is best with six players.

item.name: Masons
item.comment: Themeless diversion.

item.name: Money!
item.comment: Meaty for a quick, almost filler, game. The money cards are great.

item.name: Moongha Invaders: Mad Scientists and Atomic Monsters Attack the Earth!
Morels
item.comment: I challenge you to find a chick who would not like this pretty and smooth game.

item.name: Mykerinos
item.comment: Components surpisingly small. Just not that much depth to the gameplay.

item.name: Navegador
item.comment: Wanted to like it but found it to be boring Euro slog.

item.name: The New Yorker: Cartoon Caption Game
item.comment: Don't need the board. Just have fun coming up with witty captions to the great cartoons. Always goes over well.

item.name: No Thanks!
item.comment: Another good filler that is quick and easy to play with non-gamers.

item.name: Northwest Passage Adventure
item.comment: Incomprehensible rules plus inscrutable iconography plus meager game play equals very bad game.

item.name: Notre Dame
item.comment: Perfect weight. Involved enough for gamers and accessible enough for casual gamers.

item.name: OrlÃ©ans
item.comment: I like the game but am concerned about whether the building cards are unbalanced.

item.name: The Palaces of Carrara
item.comment: German edition.

item.name: Pick-a-Polar Bear
item.comment: What better filler? None, none better filler.

item.name: Power Grid
item.comment: Engaging but a bit formulaic.

item.name: The Princes of Florence
item.comment: All that is good about Euros and stands the test of time.

item.name: Prosperity
item.comment: Bone dry exercise.

item.name: Quiddler
item.comment: Rummy scrabble that is always a hit with non-gamers.

item.name: Richard III: The Wars of the Roses
Robinson Crusoe: Adventures on the Cursed Island
item.comment: Finally, a coop with deep game play and little down time.

item.name: Roll Through the Ages: The Bronze Age
item.comment: The ultimate beer and pretzels games?

item.name: San Juan
item.comment: Gets old quick.

item.name: Say Anything
item.comment: Can think of no better party game.

item.name: Sid Meier's Civilization: The Board Game
Spartacus: A Game of Blood & Treachery
Spyrium
item.comment: Thin and uninspiring.

item.name: Stalag 17
item.comment: Decent filler but poor quality cards.

item.name: TannhÃ¤user
item.comment: Highly playable w/ nice color coded line of sight/path system but I just don't see it being highly re-playable.

item.name: Through the Ages: A Story of Civilization
Thunder Alley
item.comment: Best in genre racing game but the ever present poor quality control from GMT is frustrating. I'd wait till the second edition to purchase.

item.name: Thurn and Taxis
item.comment: More fun than Ticket to Ride but I still need more. Supposedly the expansions make it more interesting.

item.name: Ticket to Ride
item.comment: I don't understand the popularity of this game but my wife likes it. Maybe I have my answer.

item.name: Ticket to Ride: Switzerland
item.comment: Is a more interesting version of the game and, again, my wife is a big fan.

item.name: Tigris & Euphrates
item.comment: Gives me a headache.

item.name: Tikal
item.comment: Painfully boring. I'd rather do a jigsaw puzzle and I hate jigsaw puzzles. Dry as a bone.

item.name: Totemo
item.comment: Would be a must buy at half the price.

item.name: Tournay
item.comment: Want to like this game more but it is one of those with a lot of icons to interpret that makes it difficult to teach.

item.name: Twilight Struggle
item.comment: Great gateway game to get gamers into the card driven war games.

item.name: Warhammer: Invasion
item.comment: Yet another poorly developed and implemented abuse of this license.

item.name: Wars of the Roses: Lancaster vs. York
Wilderness War
item.conditiontext: Never played and includes deluxe map.

item.name: Winner's Circle
item.comment: Delightful diversion but gets old quick.

item.name: Wits & Wagers
item.comment: Non-gamers love this party game.
